name: French in a Flash: Tapenade and Warm Goat Cheese Tartines
description: Smother toasted French sourdough with store-bought tapenade, crumble some fresh chèvre cheese on top, and broil it until the cheese softens and just begins to toast. Toss a tender and peppery salad of micro arugula, olive oil, and fleur de sel on top, and you have an incredible, sophisticated, completely easy lunch or dinner
recipeIngredient: 4 slices pain au levain, or other dense, crusty bread
1 scant teaspoon extra virgin olive oil

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the broiler. Lightly toast the bread. Spread each slice of bread with 2 teaspoons tapenade, covered the entire surface of the bread. Crumble 1 ounce goat cheese all over each slice of bread. Broil for 5 minutes. Toss the micro arugula with olive oil and salt. Cut the tartines in half, and top with micro arugula salad.
